title: North Carolina hotels under new San Antonio management
text:
monticelllo Guests checking into the former Holiday Inn Bourdeaux & Conference Center in… more San Antonio’s K Partners Hotel Management has taken over management of the Holiday Inn Bourdeaux & Conference Center in Fayetteville, North Carolina. The property, recently acquired by new ownership, will be split into two separate Wyndam Family hotels — a Ramada Plaza and a Baymont Inn & Suites. The Ramada will operate as a 195-room, full-service hotel. It will house a 32,000-square-foot conference center. The Baymont Inn & Suites will be a select-service hotel and will have 100 rooms. The property will undergo major interior and exterior renovations and upgrades to accommodate its transformation into two hotels. Shawn Kvernen , vice president of hotel operations for K Partners, said the extensive renovations will include a shared front desk for both properties. The guest rooms and lobby, as well as restaurant and lounge spaces, will be updated. The renovations will take about a year to complete, according to Kvernen. Mary Hill , senior vice president of sales and marketing for K Partners, said the plan for the two hotels is to offer “a dual brand with distinct offerings and price points,” creating two “different, but equally satisfying experiences.” K Partners, founded in 1996, has built, operated, and managed a wide portfolio of multi-branded hotels in several markets.
